description: From Latin exsertus, past participle of exsero.

verbs.description: exert (third-person singular simple present exerts, present participle exerting, simple past and past participle exerted)

examples: I exerted myself in today's training.

entries.meaning: To make use of, to apply, especially of something non-material.
examples: He considered exerting his influence on John to gain an advantage for himself.
